features.name: Dad Mode
features.description:
Dad mode requires the mixing valve hardware to be present.
When erd 0x411D is set to a non-zero number of minutes, after that period of time with continuous flow
the mixing valve will close to fully cold for a period (to eject the teenager from the shower)

required.name: Water Heater Dad Mode Delay In Minutes

features.name: Service request
features.description:
This duplicates the functionality of 0x40CC. It is necessary to allow water heaters with a broken
implementation of 0x40CC to indicate that they now support a non-broken implementation. Because 0x40CC
is disabled for GEA products, this feature is only available via 0x40C6 in GEA products.

features.name: Foundation
features.description:
Clothes Dryer Foundation provides information about the current state of the dryer.

It also allows some simple modification of the dryer temperature and dryness option settings.
- API V1 DrynessOption takes precedence over writing 0x204D Dryer Dryness Level Selection directly.
- API V1 TemperatureOption takes precedence over writing 0x2050 Dryer Temperature Level Selection directly.

features.name: Remote Start and Stop
features.description:
Clothes Dryer Remote Start and Stop V1 provides the following capabilities:
  1. Change the Delay Start duration
  2. Start a Delay Start cycle
  3. Verify the remote status of the dryer
  4. Cancel a cycle
  5. Start Extended tumble on the current cycle

API Remote Start and Stop v2 takes precedence.

features.name: Dryer Sheet Inventory
features.description:
Dryer Sheet Inventory provides the following capabilities:
  1. The client can read and write dryer sheet usage profile.
  2. The client can read the remaining dryer sheets.
  3. The client can add to and update the remaining dryer sheets.
  4. The device deducts from the remaining dryer sheets based on dryer sheet usage profile as cycles are run.

If this feature is enabled, the dryer will load the washer recommended cycle and use the additional information to modify the performance of the dry cycle.

features.name: RJ45 Write Access
features.description:
This feature allows the client to request either lock or unlock write privileges via RJ45 port. When `locked` system blocks any ERD write but keeps full ERD read capability. When `unlocked` both write and read operations are allowed.
It is the dryer's responsibility to determine when a request will be accepted and the proper timeouts for each case.
This feature follows the [Binary Options](https://github.com/geappliances/documentation.erd-specification/blob/master/docs/clothes_washer/v1/binary_options.md) documentation with the following considerations:
- 0x20CD RJ45 Access Request is the `Option Request ERD`.
- 0x20CE RJ45 Actual is the `Option ERD`.

features.name: Downloaded Cycle
features.description:
Downloaded Cycles are actually existing cycles on the unit that are not available on the IDO.
One of these cycles can be selected as the Downloaded Cycle.
The UI will provide a way for the Downloaded Cycle to be the currently selected cycle. Currently, it is a position on the knob.
This feature allows the remote user to specify which of the Downloaded Cycles should be assigned to the Downloaded Cycle position on the knob.
When the knob is in the Downloaded Cycle position, 0x20D3 Downloaded Cycle will be loaded into 0x200A Laundry Current Selected Cycle.
Not all cycles on a unit are allowed to be assigned as the Downloaded Cycle, so an ERD indicates the allowed cycles for Downloaded Cycle.

This feature follows the [Cycle with Bitmapped Allowables](https://github.com/geappliances/documentation.erd-specification/blob/master/docs/clothes_dryer/cycle_bitmap_allowables.md)
documentation with the following considerations:
- 0x20D1 Downloaded Cycle Request (Cycle Request ERD)
- 0x20D2 Downloaded Cycle Allowables (Cycles Allowed Bitmap ERD)
- 0x20D3 Downloaded Cycle Selected

The unit will maintain a default value for 0x20D3 Downloaded Cycle.

It also allows the clients to read the actual additional phases supported. When an attribute is supported, the corresponding bit in 0x211E will be set.

- 0x2120, -- Timed Cycle Total Duration Option Request (Range Option Request)

features.name: Pre Cycle Time Increment
features.description:
The Pre Cycle Time Increment feature allows the appliance to advertise support for cycle time increments purchased before the cycle start is requested on the commercial platforms.
This functionality depends completely on the Commercial Laundry Status feature where the OptionId and OptionLevel information is loaded in the OptionData fields
for the cloud to process the purchase, as well as the ERD 0x2007 which reports the resulting remaining cycle time.

features.name: Mid Cycle Time Increment
features.description: The Mid Cycle Time Increment feature allows the appliance to advertise support for cycle time increments purchases while a cycle is running on the commercial platforms.

- 0x20A9 True Rinse Option Request is the `Option Request ERD`.
- 0x20AA True Rinse Option is the `Option ERD`.

features.name: Stain Removal Guide
features.description:
The Stain Removal Guide feature allows the unit to update relevant wash parameters to achieve optimal wash performance based on the stain a user selects.
The feature follows [Bitmapped Allowable Option](https://github.com/geappliances/documentation.erd-specification/blob/master/docs/clothes_washer/v1/bitmapped_allowable_option.md)
- 0x20CF Stain Removal Guide Option shall be considered as the `Option ERD`.
- 0x20D0 Stain Removal Guide Option Request shall be considered as the `Option Request ERD`.
- 0x20D4 Stain Removal Guide Allowable Options has the information on available stain options in a cycle.
- 0x20D8 Stain Removal feature version.

features.name: Flex Dispense
features.description:
Flex Dispense feature allows clients to select from a pre-determined list of substances to dispense and in which wash stage to dispense them.
The consumer selection should correspond to the type of substance placed in the Flex Dispense tray on the washer.
Selection must be made prior to the beginning of the cycle and will not be allowed to change once the cycle is running.
The client then writes a dispense method and wash stage to the washer, and dispenses accordingly as parametrically defined.

The Flex Dispense feature follows the request and status ERD structure as documented here: https://github.com/geappliances/documentation.erd-specification#request-and-status-erds
- 0x20D5 Flex Dispense Request is used to request a change of Flex Dispense
- 0x20D6 Flex Dispense Current is used to read the current state of Flex Dispense
- 0x20D9 Flex Dispense Feature Version.

features.name: Downloadable Cycle
features.description:
The Downloadable Cycle feature allows the client to extend the number of cycles in the system by providing the option to remotely select one of the additionally provided cycles.
This feature follows [Bitmapped Allowable Option](https://github.com/geappliances/documentation.erd-specification/blob/master/docs/clothes_washer/v1/bitmapped_allowable_option.md)
- 0x20D1 Downloaded Cycle Request Option shall be considered as the `Option Request ERD`.
- 0x20D2 Downloaded Cycle Allowable Option shall be considered as the `Option Allowed Bitmap ERD`.
- 0x20D3 Downloaded Cycle Option shall be considered as the `Option ERD`.
- 0x20D7 Downloadable Cycle Feature Version Option is the Downloadable Cycle feature vesion number

features.name: Smart Dispense Adjustability
features.description:
The Smart Dispense Adjustability feature allows an optimal smart dispense performance based on the substance type, flow rate bucket, and dosage type user selects.
This documentation for this full ERD API is located at [Smart Dispense Adjustability API](https://github.com/geappliances/documentation.erd-specification/tree/master/docs/clothes_washer/v1/smart_dispense_adjustability.md).

features.name: Self Clean Reminder
features.description:
Self Clean Reminder is used to suggest a Self Clean cycle to a user.
When the unit detects it is time to run a Self Clean cycle, Self Clean Reminder signal becomes `True`. This signal will become `False` when the washer does not want suggest a Self Clean cycle.
This ERD will be set to `false`:
  1. When the user selects and runs the self clean cycle.
  2. When the user ignores the reminder and runs 3 additional cycles.

features.name: Rinse and Hold Mode Option
features.description:
Provides the owner with an out-of-cycle feature that allows a fill, circulate (without heat), and drain.
This odor reduction sequence only runs if the dishwasher door is closed and the appliance is not in end-of-cycle state.
Owners can enable or disable this option from the mobile app. The app will also display actual status while this mode is active.

features.description:
Provides the owner the ability to save their favorite cycle and options to the unit and recall them
by pressing a key on the dishwasher.

features.name: Water Softener Setting
features.description:
This setting determines how often the resin bed is regenerated by dispensing salt.
ERD 0x320A provides information on the relevant softener setting based on measured
water hardness.  ERD 0x320B allows setting this softener setting from the app.
Note that salt is only dispensed if available.  However reading or requesting a
change to this setting is always allowed.  Therefore there is no "allowable" ERD.

required.name: Water Softener Regeneration Frequency Setting Request

features.name: Auto Door Open
features.description:
This Option toggles on and off the feature that automatically opens the dishwasher door at the end of the cycle for better dry performance.
ERD 0x3263 allows toggling of this setting from the app and 0x3264 stores the state of the ERD.

features.name: MultiMode Conflict Reporting
features.description:
In a MultiZone system, when two or more of the Indoor units command the Outdoor's compressor to both Heat and Cool simultaneously, a Multi-Mode Conflict can occur.
For systems where the compressor's heat/cool algorithm is incapable of intelligent switching, and where no hardware-solution is present, this conflict must be resolved by the End-User.
This Reporting Feature enables Clients to retrieve the Multi-mode Conflict Error State.

features.name: Wash Mode option
features.description:
Allows a user to enable/disable including a wash sequence for the selected cycle.
If the wash mode option is enabled, the unit shall execute a washing cycle when a cycle is started.

This feature follows the [Binary Options](https://github.com/geappliances/documentation.erd-specification/blob/master/docs/clothes_washer/v1/binary_options.md)

features.name: Downloaded Cycle
features.description:
The Downloadable Cycle feature allows the client to "extend" the number of cycles in the system by providing the option to remotely select one of the additionally provided cycles.
This feature follows [Bitmapped Allowable Option](https://github.com/geappliances/documentation.erd-specification/blob/master/docs/clothes_washer/v1/bitmapped_allowable_option.md)
- 0x20D1 Downloaded Cycle Request Option shall be considered as the `Option Request ERD`.
- 0x20D2 Downloaded Cycle Allowable Option shall be considered as the `Option Allowed Bitmap ERD`.
- 0x20D3 Downloaded Cycle Option shall be considered as the `Option ERD`.
- 0x20D7 Downloadable Cycle Feature Version Option is the Downloadable Cycle feature version number

features.name: Delay Start
features.description: Delay Start feature allows a user to set a delay time for the appliance to start a cycle.

features.name: Remote Start
features.description:
Remote Start feature enables a user to start a cycle remotely.

Depends on:
- Smart HQ Remote Option (0x212B) must be enabled by a user at the physical UI before Remote Start can be used.

features.name: Add Dry
features.description:
Able to add a drying mode when a unit is running only with the wash mode option enabled (0x2127).

Depends on:
- Remote Add Dry Cycle Status (0x212E) must be enabled by the firmware to display "Add Dry" button from the app

A substance type (Detergent/Softener) required to be set for 0x20C1 and 0x20C2 and they shall always be set to detergent.

features.name: Sanitize Option
features.description:
This feature follows the user to select sanitize option which sets wash temperature to 90 degrees and dryness level to extra dry.
The documentation with the following considerations:
- 0x207A Dryer Sanitize Option Selection (Option ERD)
- 0x207B Dryer Sanitize Option Request (Option Request ERD)

Allowed options are defined in a JSON file hashed in ERD 0x0060.

features.name: Dry Time Selection
features.description:
This feature follows the user to change dry cycle dry time selection. This is only available for time dry cycles. The documentation with the following considerations:
- 0x20C8 Dry time selected value (Option ERD)
- 0x20CA Dry time option request (Option request ERD)

Allowed options are defined in a JSON file hashed in ERD 0x0060.

documentation with the following considerations:
- 0x2084 Control Lock Option Request (Option Request ERD)
- 0x2085 Control Lock Option Allowables (Options Allowed Bitmap ERD)

features.name: Cycle Function

features.name: Remote Pet Hair Removal Option
features.description:
This is a GEA feature that follows the [Multi-Level Client Writeable Options](https://github.com/geappliances/documentation.erd-specification/blob/master/docs/clothes_washer/v1/multi_level_client_writeable_options.md) documentation with the following considerations:
- 0x2230 Pet Hair Removal Option is the `Option ERD`.
- 0x2231 Pet Hair Removal Option Request is the `Option Request ERD`.
- 0x2232 Pet Hair Removal Option is Client Writeable is the `Option is Client Writeable ERD`.

features.name: Foundation
Indoor Temperature Sensing
features.description:
Enable ambient temperature sensing.
Useful for allow a temperature and target-temperature feedback loop.

features.name: Basic Temperature Control
features.description:
Limits the Appliance to some min/max temperature range.
Prevents users from setting out-of-range temperature values.

features.name: Indoor Humidity Sensing
features.description:
Enable ambient humidity sensing.
Useful for enabling room dehumidification.

features.name: DIP SW Equipped
features.description:
Enables reading DIP SW Status.
Used for determining personality, and controlling certain modes, used by service.

features.name: Duct Free Split Control
features.description:
This Central Controller is connected to a DFS Outdoor unit.
It is capable of performing local control on a certain number of DFS Indoor units.

features.name: Unitary Heating
features.description: The Air-Handler connected to this unit supports `heat` mode.

features.name: Unitary Cooling
features.description: The Air-Handler connected to this unit supports `cool` mode.

features.name: Unitary Auto Mode
features.description:
The Air-Handler connected to this unit supports both `heat` and `cool`.
That also enables `heat/cool` mode. Also known as `auto` mode or `2 temperature auto` mode.
The unit will be idle until the ambient temperature falls outside of these two temperatures.
It will either heat or cool as appropriate to bring the ambient temperature back in the desired range.
The temperature band where the unit is idle is called Temperature Deadband.

required.name: Auto Mode Temperature Deadband allowable range

features.name: Unitary Air Filtration
features.description:
The Air-Handler connected to this unit does not enable a feedback mechanism.
As such, the unit cannot sense the filter or its status.
This feature is a periodic interval notification that allows us to remind the user to check their filter.

features.name: Unitary Fan Control
features.description: The Air-Handler connected to this unit allows some control over the blower/fan behavior.

features.name: Unitary Mode Control
features.description:
The Air-Handler connected to this unit supports a variety of states and modes.
This feature allows the unit to communicate what modes are supported.
`idle/off` and `on` are required to be supported and have their own ERD.

features.name: Local Scheduling
features.description:
Cloud scheduling is always available when the device is connected.
Local scheduling can be turned on or off.
Note that the two do not sync nor transfer data.
In fact, Cloud scheduling interferes with Local scheduling but may be preferable in some cases.

features.name: Unitary System Service Config
features.description:
The Air-Handler connected to this unit supports advanced Service Related Configuration.
This is a collection of ERDs that enable an experienced technician to customize aspects of
unit performance.

required.name: Auxiliary Heat Minimum Temperature Delta allowable range
Indoor Ambient Temperature Sensor Calibration allowable range

Auxiliary Heat Minimum Temperature Delta Request
Indoor Ambient Temperature Sensor Calibration Status

features.name: Remote Cycle Selection
features.description:
The Remote Cycle Selection feature provides the user the ability to remotely select cycle.
This documentation for this full ERD API is located at [Remote Cycle Selection API](https://github.com/geappliances/documentation.erd-specification/tree/master/docs/clothes_washer/v1/remote_cycle_selection.md).

features.name: Downloaded Cycle
features.description:
Downloaded Cycles are actually existing cycles on the unit that are not available on the IDO.
One of these cycles can be selected as the Downloaded Cycle.
The UI will provide a way for the Downloaded Cycle to be the currently selected cycle. Currently, it is a position on the knob.
This feature allows the remote user to specify which of the Downloaded Cycles should be assigned to the Downloaded Cycle position on the knob.
When the knob is in the Downloaded Cycle position, 0x20D3 Downloaded Cycle will be loaded into 0x200A Laundry Current Selected Cycle.
Not all cycles on a unit are allowed to be assigned as the Downloaded Cycle, so an ERD indicates the allowed cycles for Downloaded Cycle.

This feature follows the [Cycle with Bitmapped Allowables](https://github.com/geappliances/documentation.erd-specification/blob/master/docs/clothes_dryer/cycle_bitmap_allowables.md)
documentation with the following considerations:
- 0x20D1 Downloaded Cycle Request (Cycle Request ERD)
- 0x20D2 Downloaded Cycle Allowables (Cycles Allowed Bitmap ERD)
- 0x20D3 Downloaded Cycle Selected

The unit will maintain a default value for 0x20D3 Downloaded Cycle.

features.name: Dry Time Option

features.name: Water Tank Notifications and Warnings
features.description:

These tanks will need to be emptied or filled up from time to time.

features.name: Item Count Option
features.description:
Allows the user to specify the number of items in the machine.  It is suited to specialty cycles which are finely tuned for a low

- 0x2084 Control Lock Option Request (Option Request ERD)
- 0x2085 Control Lock Option Allowables (Options Allowed Bitmap ERD)

features.name: Sign of Life
features.description:
This ERD is used by the appliance and the Android UI to determine whether the other party is alive and well. The
client writes to the ERD to indicate that it is alive and well, and the device publishes it back to the client to
indicate that it is alive and well.

This can also be used by the Android UI to determine when all subscriptions have been published by the appliance
and the initial sync has been completed. This is because the sign of life ERD can only be published twice if all
other ERDs have been published. Because the sign of life ERD changes once per second, the second publication will
happen within 1 second of all other ERDs being published.
